posts.subject: 8Chan Refugees Blow Their Anonymity
posts.body:
==(((JOURNALIST))) BRAGS ABOUT TRACKING "ANONS" ON 08CHAN==
>A reincarnated version of the hate-filled forum, now linked to three mass shootings, appeared Monday when the original 8chan lost its hosting service. The new site, called 08chan (with a leading zero), has no affiliation with the original and it’s not entirely clear who set it up, but 8chan’s diaspora have been flooding in as word of the site spreads through right-wing social media.
>There’s just one catch. Peer-to-peer networks expose a user’s internet address to anyone who cares to look. That’s how copyright lawyers catch people trading movies, music and software, and it’s how police and FBI agents arrest pedophiles trading child porn online.
>The Daily Beast captured 819 IP addresses for 08chan users connecting from 62 different countries. Most users in our sample, 437 of them, are in the U.S., with Canada (46 users), and the U.K. (37), a distant second and third place. Ordered by states, California, Texas, Washington, and Florida top the list. 
https://archive.fo/4vAKm

posts.subject: "8Chan Refugees Blow Their Anonymity"
posts.body:
==(((JOURNALIST))) BRAGS ABOUT TRACKING "ANONS" ON 08CHAN==
>A reincarnated version of the hate-filled forum, now linked to three mass shootings, appeared Monday when the original 8chan lost its hosting service. The new site, called 08chan (with a leading zero), has no affiliation with the original and it’s not entirely clear who set it up, but 8chan’s diaspora have been flooding in as word of the site spreads through right-wing social media.
>There’s just one catch. Peer-to-peer networks expose a user’s internet address to anyone who cares to look. That’s how copyright lawyers catch people trading movies, music and software, and it’s how police and FBI agents arrest pedophiles trading child porn online.
>The Daily Beast captured 819 IP addresses for 08chan users connecting from 62 different countries. Most users in our sample, 437 of them, are in the U.S., with Canada (46 users), and the U.K. (37), a distant second and third place. Ordered by states, California, Texas, Washington, and Florida top the list. 
https://archive.fo/4vAKm

The problem, as I understand it is that IPs can only be linked because of seeding (this is P2P after all), but they cannot link anyone to a particular post, thanks to certificates. 
This is why the admin needs to adapt the system so that we can use self signed certs but also minimize spam bots.

>>d96ddf37-b463-4f1e-9384-945a52d7bcd0
>Maybe if they had a lot of compute and network bandwidth they could distinguish whether any given new message they received was a new post or just being distributed by the network by analyzing how fast it spreads, since it'd spread exponentially faster
I don't think so. Since it uses BitTorrent, aren't files transferred in packets? There would be no easy way to learn exactly where each packet fits and exactly who is the originator for each packet. Plus, ZeroNet requires a post to be seeded by 5 other peers, so each post has 6 peers immediately seeding it upon posting.

>>d96ddf37-b463-4f1e-9384-945a52d7bcd0
>How does ZeroID allow them to link posts with IPs?
It doesn't. It just means that users can have all their posts tracked across 08chan because they can't change certificates as easily anymore.

>>a9261e18-ca3e-4548-aa7f-2cf978b64f3f
>If the association pops up two or three times in the database, you can almost be sure it wasn't a false positive and the IP does indeed correspond to that ID.
That would be very convenient, seeing as you cannot decide who you are peering with. I'm pretty sure there are anons who have posted that haven't seeded from each other at all despite being a regular user. Maybe Feds will try to pin something on an anon as scare tactics?

Even the cuck spammer made a better OP than faggot OP.
==GIVE US THE SOURCE OR GTFO==

>>e00a7bed-f90b-4b7e-9dc2-cd79a8c03fbf
>If they know the approximate time the IP was recorded, they can call up the ISP and ask them to tell them the person who had that IP assigned at that moment in time. ISPs keep track of that stuff precisely for that reason.
Firstly, do ISPs give random data like that to journalists? Law enforcement makes sense, but the newest soy filled, testosterone lacking journo is probably not going to have the balls to acquire such info without (((help))).
It would also be nay impossible to determine who posted what exactly. I can't see that article being anything of relevance.

>>23342632-3013-4a9a-a3b1-0fea54c2ebc4
>We can only see it because we had it downloaded before the switch.
So newfags won't seed any spam, any of the sticky's or tech posts about the difference between ZeroNet and clearnet?

>>fda389ec-7399-4e4f-afdd-baf4f3c6caa1
This also explains why I'm seeing new posts on the index, but clicking on them leads to empty threads.

>>69c118cd-1dd6-4b31-af98-6be5b3c1df0c
>Here is that content.json from the new instance you asked for
Put this in the [code] tags, like this:
[code][code]Insert code here[/ code][/code]

>>c2985b0f-a860-4760-82ee-cfc538944ece
>banning any IPs
That's not even an option. ZeroNet runs user tracking from certificates, not IPs.

>>acb837fb-57b2-4afe-a730-c101178e7fde
That's because it's "[code][/code]"
I couldn't get it to display properly, which is why I put the space in the second set of brackets.
==UPDATE: ADMIN, PLEASE FIX TORPOSTING FFS==

>>da22480f-e4b0-403a-b0bb-f0ea155cb3eb
>they're going to be the main bunker due to the lower barrier to entry
/v/aggots are LARPers clearly
FEDs unironically didn't lurk for two years and exposed themselves as glowniggers

>>3fc0eccd-2587-424d-bdeb-7cf7fd912cda
>when you upload with TOR browser and use TOR to connect (in my case), the files are 'uploaded' but only as thumbs
TORposting works perfectly on Millchan, so the admin needs to update the 08chan script to the newer version.

>>79046896-b59e-4901-87e9-b40042a217d7
> I notice that even though I'm also on a ZeroID, my own [m] shows it coming from @08chan, but on a cert that I know I got from ZeroID
I noticed this too. It wasn't like this when the change was made to the spammer, but now every post refers to an 08chan ID, even on the other ZeroIDs I have.
Edit: Looking now, I'm able to see this 08chan identity address box, but when I select to change it, the ZeroID and a completely differen 08chan ID is available to select.

>>71cadec5-f71d-4fc1-bc87-401e59983596
>Weird.
Very strange indeed.

>>36eb24e8-a3ed-447b-b82a-f7a67a221cec
>I'm more concerned about being enablers of tripfags myself
If someone wants to tripfag, you can mute them out of existence. Remember that making alts is a different issue altogether.
